basics.name: Arisa Nakai
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences as well as Business Management at Shidler College of Business at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

work.summary: Teach English & Math to students from Pre-K to High School level
highlights: As a dedicated tutor, I provide personalized academic support to students ranging from PreK to high school. My work spans a variety of subjects, helping students develop critical skills, build confidence, and excel in their academic journeys.
I take a personalized approach to each student's learning, tailoring lessons and test prep to meet their individual needs and academic goals.
Assisting with Private School Enrollment Process

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen, degree-seeking applicants who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.6 or higher at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Academic Honors Recognition
awards.awarder: State of Hawai'i Department of Education
awards.summary: Recognized for exceptional academic achievement, requiring a minimum 3.0 GPA, completion of advanced coursework in both lab sciences and mathematics, and participation in AP, IB, or Running Start programs.

awards.title: Career and Technical Education (CTE) Honors Recognition
awards.awarder: State of Hawai'i Department of Education
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence in Career and Technical Education (CTE) through the completion of a focused program in Business, consisting of 3 years of coursework and a performance-based assessment. I successfully met or exceeded the assessment criteria, demonstrating strong practical skills and proficiency in business concepts.

awards.title: Seal of Biliteracy
awards.awarder: State of Hawai'i Department of Education
awards.summary: Earned the Seal of Biliteracy in recognition of my proficiency in English and a second language. With a minimum 3.0 GPA, successful completion of Language Arts courses, and a score of 5 on AP Japanese, it shows my bilingual abilities and commitment to linguistic diversity.

awards.title: AP Scholar
awards.summary: Awarded by the College Board for exceptional academic achievement and high scores across multiple Advanced Placement exams, demonstrating college-level mastery in rigorous subject areas.
